botLot.dataSource

Class BotLotDS

  • java.lang.Object
    • botLot.dataSource.BotLotDS

  • public class BotLotDS
extends java.lang.Object
    Class BotLotDS "BotLot Data Source"

    Handles the retrieval and saving of LotGraphs.

    Supports: XML

    Planned to support: MySQL, MSSql, POSTGRESQL.

    Started: 10/26/15

    Version:
    1.0 12/10/15
    Author:
    Greg Stewart

    • Constructor Detail

      • BotLotDS

        public BotLotDS(java.lang.String dataSourceType,
                java.lang.String pathLoginIn)
         throws BotLotDSException
        Constructor for the data source object.
        Parameters:
        dataSourceType - The data type. Use this class's *_DATASRC variables.
        pathLoginIn - Either the path to the XML file, or string XML data giving the data needed for connecting to a database (Use getServerConnectionXML(String, String, String) to generate this.).
        Throws:
        BotLotDSException - If something went wrong, mostly if invalid data is entered.

      • BotLotDS

        public BotLotDS()
        Empty constructor, for initialization when you don't want to specify things

    • Method Detail

      • getServerConnectionXML

        public static java.lang.String getServerConnectionXML(java.lang.String serverURL,
                                                      java.lang.String userName,
                                                      java.lang.String password)
                                               throws BotLotException
        Creates an XML string that contains the information needed to setup a database connection.

        Use this to give the constructor the pathLoginIn information.

        Based on this tutorial: http://examples.javacodegeeks.com/core-java/xml/dom/create-dom-document-from-scratch/

        Parameters:
        serverURL - The URL of the server, including port number.
        userName - The username to use when connecting.
        password - The password of the user.
        Returns:
        A string form of an XML document holding the information needed to login to a database.
        Throws:
        BotLotException - If something went wrong.

        public static java.lang.String sanitizeStringData(java.lang.String stringIn)
        Sanitizes strings for use in database connections.
        Parameters:
        stringIn - The string to sanitize.
        Returns:
        The sanitized string.

      • dbConnects

        public boolean dbConnects()
                   throws BotLotDSException
        Tests if the database will connect with the current setup of the data source.
        Returns:
        If we can connect to the data or not.
        Throws:
        BotLotDSException - If the data source type is not a database.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        If the data is valid or not.

        A database connection string.

                        throws BotLotDSException

        If the path to an XML document is valid.
        Throws:
        BotLotDSException - If the type of datasource is not XML.

      • isDatabaseSource

        public static boolean isDatabaseSource(java.lang.String dataSourceType)
        Determines if the string entered denotes a database data source.
        Parameters:
        dataSourceType - The data source to test against.
        Returns:
        If the datasource type given is a database or not.
